channel.title: How would you prefer to "Donate"
channel.description:
Most rsps owners will depend on payments (or "donations") from players keep themselves afloat. However, the typical server will have one of the following: 1) You send money to the owners paypal, then the owner gives you the item. 2) You're presented with a few items and can pick from the list, and then get the item from the owner. 3) Same scenario as 2, but there's an auto donation system in play.
However, there is also the system like ikov has. Where you purchase a fixed amount of tokens and then purchase the items with said tokens. Runescape uses the same idea for solomons.
What do you guys think? Do you think that token-based shops are better than paying for the item(s) alone?

item.title: How would you prefer to "Donate"
item.dc:creator: @doom_j doom_j
item.description:
@doom_j wrote:

[quote=“Davidi2, post:11, topic:542153”][quote author=Ashi link=topic=661030.msg4419042#msg4419042 date=1397508456]

Also, fuck everyone that tries to say its still “donating” if you’re buying tokens or items. If you donate you don’t get ANYTHING in return.

A lot of charities give you thank you packs for donating. Would you still call that donating? ofc.
[/quote]You’re not ‘buying’ thank you packs. You aren’t saying ‘wow i really want that thank you pack even though it’s more than its worth I think ill donate’. The only thing you could try and compare it to would be like television Public Broadcasting where they sell products for extremely high prices and say they need it to keep the station running, and even then you have to deduct the real cost of the item from your donation when looking at things like tax deductions.

https://pbs.secure.force.com/forms/donate (this is a real donation page)
http://www.shoppbs.org/home/index.jsp?clickid=mainnav_home_img

http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Donation

Donations are given without return consideration.

If you get something in return for a donation, legally (in the United States at least) you can only call the difference in value a donation. It’s called a quid pro quo donation. If you donate 100 dollars and get a 30 dollar gift, you can only legally say you donated 70 dollars. In the case of these ‘donation shops’, they are valuing their “products” at the listed price, making the difference between the donation and the cost of the item zero. You’re buying an item from a store, not making a donation.[/quote]

I am glad someone agrees with me.

item.title: How would you prefer to "Donate"
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

It depends on what you’re going for. If you want a lot of money, microtransactions for another type of currency are the way to go. People are more likely to spend money if the things they are buying do not have an exact dollar amount linked to them. For example someone is much more likely to buy a partyhat if you sell it for 1000 tokens rather than 10.00 dollars, even if 1000 tokens costs about 10 dollars. That said, my personal opinion has been that anything you can buy with real money shouldn’t have a significant impact on the game. Unfortunately this isnt the best way to make money so people dont do it. But if I was going to spend money it would be purely cosmetic.

Also, fuck everyone that tries to say its still “donating” if you’re buying tokens or items. If you donate you don’t get ANYTHING in return.
